Hi, I'm new here and have a little question:

" How can I increase the mass limit in the career mode?"

I will wait for answer, thanks !!

" How can I increase the mass limit in the career mode?"
Upgrade the Launch Pad or the Runway, as appropriate.

If you find yourself launching several copies of the same ship, then you can do so directly from the Launch Pad - just click on it in the Spaceport scene like you click on the VAB.

The new Career has many such restrictions that will require you to upgrade parts of your launch complex in order to acomplish more complex objectives.

Examples;

1. The 18 tons to launch pad limit.

2. The 30 part limit in the VAB

3. No EVA in space until the Astronaut Complex gets an upgrade.

4. No Add Maneuver Mode in Map Mode until you upgrade both Mission Control and Tracking Station.

5. A 100 Science Point limit until you upgrade the Research complex.

All have a varying degree of cost with some being extremely expensive.

This is why you are seeing those topics of No SAS on Stayputnik, No Maneuver Mode, Career suddenly very hard, etc... popping up among those that have been play the game prior to 0.90 Beta.

Working on a Career tutorial challenge of several days which I will post after I have been able to find solutions to achieving the objectives I have set for it.

Upgrade the launchpad to allow heavier rockets, upgrade the runway to allow heavier planes.

P.S.!!!

If cash-strapped and desperate, you only need to update ONE of the two.

You can launch rockets from the runway just fine.

Design them in the VAB, then import to Hangar and launch.

Or vice versa.
